title: Eszköztárak és egyéb kinézete
content: Hogyan lehet visszakapni a 115-ös verzió előtti kinézetet? A menüsor alá akarom az eszköztárat, és úgy egyébként is mindent úgy szeretnék mint volt. A jelenlegi kinézet meglehetősen rút és kényelmetlen. A kinézetben történt változások nem kellettek volna...
creator: gaja1

title: Junk folder mysteriously missing for two of my three accounts after upgrading to v115.2.0
content:
I have three email accounts configured in Thunderbird. I updated to whatever the very last release is before v115, and when I was reading the Release Notes it said no more patches would be made for that version, and recommended upgrading to v115.2.0. I upgraded and now two of my three Junk folders are missing. After checking my settings (both accounts in question are set to "Move new junk messages to: Junk folder on <INSERT_ACCOUNT_NAME>" and doing a bunch of Googling I have no explanation as to why they've disappeared. As a test, I marked a message as Junk on one of the impacted accounts and the message disappeared from my Inbox and was nowhere to be found (I then had to press CTRL-Z to get it to reappear in my Inbox).

How do I restore the two missing Junk folders please?
creator: reed7

title: Thunderbird Win10 to Win10 migrations for local mail using 102.15.0 (up to date)
content: Migrating TB on Win10 to Win10. Downloaded install program to match my up to date version on the original computer (102.15.0 (64bit) which reports it is up to date (on release update channel). Local mail of 15+ years. Large collection. Copied contents from the two profile folders into the new ones created on the install (one with times.json, the other all my local mail plus). Searched site for matching version (102.15.0) to install. Copied contents of orig profile files to the files created in app data on new computer. Both using Win10. Started over several times, using restore, deleting app data and/or reinstalling windows. Made different copies of App Data. The address books, calendar, tasks, came thorough. But there is no local mail. Have not connected for new mail. Have migrated before. Figured out how to use your new help system (complicated and not sure I am posting in the correct place). Have been working on this for about 10 days. Stumped. Missing some bits of knowledge. Have not downloaded any new mail. Would appreciate some help or advice. Thanks.
creator: Renders

Cause this problem make thunderbird useless.
creator: fits79

title: Thunderbird v 115.2.0 (64-bit) Calendar no longer sending invites
content:
Thunderbird v 115.2.0 (64-bit) Calendar no longer sending invites TO MEETING GUESTS

I've been using Thunderbird successfully for over a year but in the last month it will no longer send invites to invitees from calendar booked meetings.

It shows the meeting in my calendar but no longer sends as confirmation to myself saying I have accepted the meeting but my invitees receive nothing.

any suggestions... the only thing that I changed recently on my machine was an AVAST VPN it doesn't seem to matter what location it is set to or switched off the calendar problem still remains.

See Screen Shots 5 steps to no invite jpeg below

STEP 1 - Meeting example set with one invitee STEP 2 - Meeting invite Sent STEP 3 - Diary Space Booked & Email Received Say I Have Accepted Meeting invite STEP 4 - Copy of Email Received Say I Have Accepted Meeting invite STEP 5 - No Invite Sent
creator: kingfishproperty

title: Reply in HTML only if the original is in HTML
content:
I use TB for work emails (often HTML) and open source participation (== patches). I am looking for an option to reply to patches in plain test and reply in HTML to whoever sent me an HTML. The closest is "Sending format" where "Automatic" is the closest.

When replying to plain text mails, I can accidentally press, for example, press "ctrl-b" which adds styling and makes TB send HTML a warning or indication that the reply suddenly became HTML <- this autoswitch is what I am trying to avoif as this becomes a problem with Linux mailling lists as those people hate HTMLs (for technical reasons).

So right now I have to keep the "Composition and Addressing" tab open to switch "Compose messages in HTML format" which is a bit ridiculous.

Is there a better way? Having an option in a folder would do, for example. Thanks,
creator: aikbox

title: 115.2.0 (64 bit) fails to check for updates
content:
Hi, Ever since I updated to Supernova, I have been unable to check for updates from Thunderbird and receive the notice "Failed to check for updates". In addition, the opening splash screen fails to load. And, worst of all, a few select web sites will no longer load from any browser I try. I am ALMOST certain that this happened after the update to Supernova. See attached screenshot Several Thunderbird threads seem to indicate that I should check that "Application Experience" should be checked, but I have no such service on my machine. any help appreciated!!!

Running Windows 10 Pro on a i7-6700 @4.00 Ghz, 32 gb RAM

title: URL in Thunderbird HTML signature turns and stays purple.
content: I created an HTML signature for one of my Thunderbird email accounts. It has my name, photo and a link to my Website. This was done as a new TB message and saved as an HTML file. It worked just fine on a couple of outgoing emails, but to see how it looked at the receiving end I sent it to myself on another TB account. Going to that account's Inbox and opening the email, the signature looked great, but to test the link I clicked on the Web address. It took me to my Website and, of course, the link in the email turned from blue to purple, as one would expect it to do. Trouble is, when I repeated the test, the second receipt had the URL link purple already. And, just looking at the HTML file the signature points to using Firefox, it's purple there too! So how did the signature file get changed, how do I fix this? I've unchecked the TB setup box that says 'remember sites I've visited,' thinking that might be the cause, but the URL is still purple. Thanks for any tips.
creator: Electrojim

title: Login to server pop.1and1.com with username xxxxxxxxx@tmrl.net failed
content:
A couple of days ago, I upgraded to SuperNova. At first everything went well. A day later I started to get error box stating "Login to server pop.1and1.com with username xxxxxxxxx@tmrl.net failed".

I click "Retry" and it seems okay. I run 18 accounts and every account can/will create it's own error box.

Email does come in except for when these error boxes open.
creator: shop01
